bug.author: monchier
bug.summary: st.slider output value does not reset
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>How to repro</denchmark-h>
Run this script with streamlit
<denchmark-code>import streamlit as st
end = int(st.sidebar.text_input('Input:', '10')) slider_output = st.sidebar.slider('slider', 0, end, 0) st.write(selected_frame_index) </denchmark-code>
This is how it shows in the browser
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6821233/64983594-bc186780-d875-11e9-83ca-4ec03c87704a.png></denchmark-link>
Change the input to 10 and move the slider all the way to the right. The number 10 should appear in the main column
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6821233/64983612-c2a6df00-d875-11e9-9e2b-c4ee994eaa08.png></denchmark-link>
Change the input value back to 1
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6821233/64983617-c8042980-d875-11e9-9b86-08f13239658b.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h1>What happens</denchmark-h>
The value in the main column is 10 <denchmark-h:h1>What should happen:</denchmark-h>
The value in the main column should not be 10, but it should be within the bounds of the slider

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/monchier>@monchier</denchmark-link> I think this is fixed, I did all steps to reproduce it but the value is resetting to 0. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22157341/67691234-fef15300-f97c-11e9-86c4-1678bc49eb31.png></denchmark-link>
